00003 static int stbi__pvr_test(stbi__context *s)
00004 {
00005         //      check header size
00006         if (stbi__get32le(s) != sizeof(PVR_Texture_Header)) {
00007                 stbi__rewind(s);
00008                 return 0;
00009         }
00010 
00011         // stbi__skip until the magic number
00012         stbi__skip(s, 10*4);
00013 
00014         // check the magic number
00015         if ( stbi__get32le(s) != PVRTEX_IDENTIFIER ) {
00016                 stbi__rewind(s);
00017                 return 0;
00018         }
00019 
00020         // Also rewind because the loader needs to read the header
00021         stbi__rewind(s);
00022 
00023         return 1;
00024 }

00028 int      stbi__pvr_test_filename                        (char const *filename)
00029 {
00030    int r;
00031    FILE *f = fopen(filename, "rb");
00032    if (!f) return 0;
00033    r = stbi__pvr_test_file(f);
00034    fclose(f);
00035    return r;
00036 }

00038 int      stbi__pvr_test_file        (FILE *f)
00039 {
00040    stbi__context s;
00041    int r,n = ftell(f);
00042    stbi__start_file(&s,f);
00043    r = stbi__pvr_test(&s);
00044    fseek(f,n,SEEK_SET);
00045    return r;
00046 }

00062 
00063 static int stbi__pvr_info(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int * iscompressed )
00064 {
00065         PVR_Texture_Header header={0};
00066 
00067         stbi__getn( s, (stbi_uc*)(&header), sizeof(PVR_Texture_Header) );
00068 
00069         // Check the header size
00070         if ( header.dwHeaderSize != sizeof(PVR_Texture_Header) ) {
00071                 stbi__rewind( s );
00072                 return 0;
00073         }
00074 
00075         // Check the magic identifier
00076         if ( header.dwPVR != PVRTEX_IDENTIFIER ) {
00077                 stbi__rewind(s);
00078                 return 0;
00079         }
00080 
00081         *x = s->img_x = header.dwWidth;
00082         *y = s->img_y = header.dwHeight;
00083         *comp = s->img_n = ( header.dwBitCount + 7 ) / 8;
00084 
00085         if ( iscompressed )
00086                 *iscompressed = 0;
00087 
00088         switch ( header.dwpfFlags & PVRTEX_PIXELTYPE )
00089         {
00090                 case OGL_RGBA_4444:
00091                         s->img_n = 2;
00092                         break;
00093                 case OGL_RGBA_5551:
00094                         s->img_n = 2;
00095                         break;
00096                 case OGL_RGBA_8888:
00097                         s->img_n = 4;
00098                         break;
00099                 case OGL_RGB_565:
00100                         s->img_n = 2;
00101                         break;
00102                 case OGL_RGB_888:
00103                         s->img_n = 3;
00104                         break;
00105                 case OGL_I_8:
00106                         s->img_n = 1;
00107                         break;
00108                 case OGL_AI_88:
00109                         s->img_n = 2;
00110                         break;
00111                 case OGL_PVRTC2:
00112                         s->img_n = 4;
00113                         if ( iscompressed )
00114                                 *iscompressed = 1;
00115                         break;
00116                 case OGL_PVRTC4:
00117                         s->img_n = 4;
00118                         if ( iscompressed )
00119                                 *iscompressed = 1;
00120                         break;
00121                 case OGL_RGB_555:
00122                 default:
00123                         stbi__rewind(s);
00124                         return 0;
00125         }
00126 
00127         *comp = s->img_n;
00128 
00129         return 1;
00130 }

00133 {

00135         stbi__start_mem(&s,buffer, len);

00140 {

00142         stbi__start_callbacks(&s, (stbi_io_callbacks *) clbk, user);

00158 {

00160    int res;
00161    long n = ftell(f);
00162    stbi__start_file(&s, f);
00163    res = stbi__pvr_info(&s, x, y, comp, iscompressed);
00164    fseek(f, n, SEEK_SET);
00165    return res;

00178 typedef unsigned char      PVRTuint8;
00179 typedef unsigned short     PVRTuint16;
00180 typedef unsigned int       PVRTuint32;

00182 /*****************************************************************************
00183  * defines and consts
00184  *****************************************************************************/
00185 #define PT_INDEX (2)    // The Punch-through index
00186 
00187 #define BLK_Y_SIZE      (4) // always 4 for all 2D block types
00188 
00189 #define BLK_X_MAX       (8)     // Max X dimension for blocks
00190 
00191 #define BLK_X_2BPP      (8) // dimensions for the two formats
00192 #define BLK_X_4BPP      (4)
00193 
00194 #define WRAP_COORD(Val, Size) ((Val) & ((Size)-1))
00195 
00196 #define POWER_OF_2(X)   util_number_is_power_2(X)
00197 
00198 /*
00199         Define an expression to either wrap or clamp large or small vals to the
00200         legal coordinate range
00201 */
00202 #define PVRT_MIN(a,b)            (((a) < (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00203 #define PVRT_MAX(a,b)            (((a) > (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00204 #define PVRT_CLAMP(x, l, h)      (PVRT_MIN((h), PVRT_MAX((x), (l))))
00205 
00206 #define LIMIT_COORD(Val, Size, AssumeImageTiles) \
00207           ((AssumeImageTiles)? WRAP_COORD((Val), (Size)): PVRT_CLAMP((Val), 0, (Size)-1))
00208

00210  * Useful typedefs
00211  *****************************************************************************/

00213 typedef PVRTuint8 U8;

00219 /*!***********************************************************************
00220  @Struct        AMTC_BLOCK_STRUCT
00221  @Brief
00222 *************************************************************************/
00223 typedef struct
00224 {
00225         // Uses 64 bits pre block
00226         U32 PackedData[2];
00227 }AMTC_BLOCK_STRUCT;
00228 
00229  /*!***********************************************************************
00230   @Function             util_number_is_power_2
00231   @Input                input A number
00232   @Returns              TRUE if the number is an integer power of two, else FALSE.
00233   @Description  Check that a number is an integer power of two, i.e.
00234                                 1, 2, 4, 8, ... etc.
00235                                 Returns FALSE for zero.
00236 *************************************************************************/
00237 int util_number_is_power_2( unsigned  input )
00238 {
00239   unsigned minus1;
00240 
00241   if( !input ) return 0;
00242 
00243   minus1 = input - 1;
00244   return ( (input | minus1) == (input ^ minus1) ) ? 1 : 0;
00245 }
00246 
00247 /*!***********************************************************************
00248  @Function              Unpack5554Colour
00249  @Input                 pBlock
00250  @Input                 ABColours
00251  @Description   Given a block, extract the colour information and convert
00252                                 to 5554 formats
00253 *************************************************************************/
00254 static void Unpack5554Colour(const AMTC_BLOCK_STRUCT *pBlock,
00255                                                          int   ABColours[2][4])
00256 {
00257         U32 RawBits[2];
00258 
00259         int i;
00260 
00261         // Extract A and B
00262         RawBits[0] = pBlock->PackedData[1] & (0xFFFE); // 15 bits (shifted up by one)
00263         RawBits[1] = pBlock->PackedData[1] >> 16;          // 16 bits
00264 
00265         // step through both colours
00266         for(i = 0; i < 2; i++)
00267         {
00268                 // If completely opaque
00269                 if(RawBits[i] & (1<<15))
00270                 {
00271                         // Extract R and G (both 5 bit)
00272                         ABColours[i][0] = (RawBits[i] >> 10) & 0x1F;
00273                         ABColours[i][1] = (RawBits[i] >>  5) & 0x1F;
00274 
00275                         /*
00276                                 The precision of Blue depends on  A or B. If A then we need to
00277                                 replicate the top bit to get 5 bits in total
00278                         */
00279                         ABColours[i][2] = RawBits[i] & 0x1F;
00280                         if(i==0)
00281                         {
00282                                 ABColours[0][2] |= ABColours[0][2] >> 4;
00283                         }
00284 
00285                         // set 4bit alpha fully on...
00286                         ABColours[i][3] = 0xF;
00287                 }
00288                 else // Else if colour has variable translucency
00289                 {
00290                         /*
00291                                 Extract R and G (both 4 bit).
00292                                 (Leave a space on the end for the replication of bits
00293                         */
00294                         ABColours[i][0] = (RawBits[i] >>  (8-1)) & 0x1E;
00295                         ABColours[i][1] = (RawBits[i] >>  (4-1)) & 0x1E;
00296 
00297                         // replicate bits to truly expand to 5 bits
00298                         ABColours[i][0] |= ABColours[i][0] >> 4;
00299                         ABColours[i][1] |= ABColours[i][1] >> 4;
00300 
00301                         // grab the 3(+padding) or 4 bits of blue and add an extra padding bit
00302                         ABColours[i][2] = (RawBits[i] & 0xF) << 1;
00303 
00304                         /*
00305                                 expand from 3 to 5 bits if this is from colour A, or 4 to 5 bits if from
00306                                 colour B
00307                         */
00308                         if(i==0)
00309                         {
00310                                 ABColours[0][2] |= ABColours[0][2] >> 3;
00311                         }
00312                         else
00313                         {
00314                                 ABColours[0][2] |= ABColours[0][2] >> 4;
00315                         }
00316 
00317                         // Set the alpha bits to be 3 + a zero on the end
00318                         ABColours[i][3] = (RawBits[i] >> 11) & 0xE;
00319                 }
00320         }
00321 }
00322 
00323 /*!***********************************************************************
00324  @Function              UnpackModulations
00325  @Input                 pBlock
00326  @Input                 Do2bitMode
00327  @Input                 ModulationVals
00328  @Input                 ModulationModes
00329  @Input                 StartX
00330  @Input                 StartY
00331  @Description   Given the block and the texture type and it's relative
00332                                 position in the 2x2 group of blocks, extract the bit
00333                                 patterns for the fully defined pixels.
00334 *************************************************************************/
00335 static void     UnpackModulations(const AMTC_BLOCK_STRUCT *pBlock,
00336                                                           const int Do2bitMode,
00337                                                           int ModulationVals[8][16],
00338                                                           int ModulationModes[8][16],
00339                                                           int StartX,
00340                                                           int StartY)
00341 {
00342         int BlockModMode;
00343         U32 ModulationBits;
00344 
00345         int x, y;
00346 
00347         BlockModMode= pBlock->PackedData[1] & 1;
00348         ModulationBits  = pBlock->PackedData[0];
00349 
00350         // if it's in an interpolated mode
00351         if(Do2bitMode && BlockModMode)
00352         {
00353                 /*
00354                         run through all the pixels in the block. Note we can now treat all the
00355                         "stored" values as if they have 2bits (even when they didn't!)
00356                 */
00357                 for(y = 0; y < BLK_Y_SIZE; y++)
00358                 {
00359                         for(x = 0; x < BLK_X_2BPP; x++)
00360                         {
00361                                 ModulationModes[y+StartY][x+StartX] = BlockModMode;
00362 
00363                                 // if this is a stored value...
00364                                 if(((x^y)&1) == 0)
00365                                 {
00366                                         ModulationVals[y+StartY][x+StartX] = ModulationBits & 3;
00367                                         ModulationBits >>= 2;
00368                                 }
00369                         }
00370                 }
00371         }
00372         else if(Do2bitMode) // else if direct encoded 2bit mode - i.e. 1 mode bit per pixel
00373         {
00374                 for(y = 0; y < BLK_Y_SIZE; y++)
00375                 {
00376                         for(x = 0; x < BLK_X_2BPP; x++)
00377                         {
00378                                 ModulationModes[y+StartY][x+StartX] = BlockModMode;
00379 
00380                                 // double the bits so 0=> 00, and 1=>11
00381                                 if(ModulationBits & 1)
00382                                 {
00383                                         ModulationVals[y+StartY][x+StartX] = 0x3;
00384                                 }
00385                                 else
00386                                 {
00387                                         ModulationVals[y+StartY][x+StartX] = 0x0;
00388                                 }
00389                                 ModulationBits >>= 1;
00390                         }
00391                 }
00392         }
00393         else // else its the 4bpp mode so each value has 2 bits
00394         {
00395                 for(y = 0; y < BLK_Y_SIZE; y++)
00396                 {
00397                         for(x = 0; x < BLK_X_4BPP; x++)
00398                         {
00399                                 ModulationModes[y+StartY][x+StartX] = BlockModMode;
00400 
00401                                 ModulationVals[y+StartY][x+StartX] = ModulationBits & 3;
00402                                 ModulationBits >>= 2;
00403                         }
00404                 }
00405         }
00406 
00407         // make sure nothing is left over
00408         assert(ModulationBits==0);
00409 }
00410 
00411 /*!***********************************************************************
00412  @Function              InterpolateColours
00413  @Input                 ColourP
00414  @Input                 ColourQ
00415  @Input                 ColourR
00416  @Input                 ColourS
00417  @Input                 Do2bitMode
00418  @Input                 x
00419  @Input                 y
00420  @Modified              Result
00421  @Description   This performs a HW bit accurate interpolation of either the
00422                                 A or B colours for a particular pixel.
00423 
00424                                 NOTE: It is assumed that the source colours are in ARGB 5554
00425                                 format - This means that some "preparation" of the values will
00426                                 be necessary.
00427 *************************************************************************/
00428 static void InterpolateColours(const int ColourP[4],
00429                                                   const int ColourQ[4],
00430                                                   const int ColourR[4],
00431                                                   const int ColourS[4],
00432                                                   const int Do2bitMode,
00433                                                   const int x,
00434                                                   const int y,
00435                                                   int Result[4])
00436 {
00437         int u, v, uscale;
00438         int k;
00439 
00440         int tmp1, tmp2;
00441 
00442         int P[4], Q[4], R[4], S[4];
00443 
00444         // Copy the colours
00445         for(k = 0; k < 4; k++)
00446         {
00447                 P[k] = ColourP[k];
00448                 Q[k] = ColourQ[k];
00449                 R[k] = ColourR[k];
00450                 S[k] = ColourS[k];
00451         }
00452 
00453         // put the x and y values into the right range
00454         v = (y & 0x3) | ((~y & 0x2) << 1);
00455 
00456         if(Do2bitMode)
00457                 u = (x & 0x7) | ((~x & 0x4) << 1);
00458         else
00459                 u = (x & 0x3) | ((~x & 0x2) << 1);
00460 
00461         // get the u and v scale amounts
00462         v  = v - BLK_Y_SIZE/2;
00463 
00464         if(Do2bitMode)
00465         {
00466                 u = u - BLK_X_2BPP/2;
00467                 uscale = 8;
00468         }
00469         else
00470         {
00471                 u = u - BLK_X_4BPP/2;
00472                 uscale = 4;
00473         }
00474 
00475         for(k = 0; k < 4; k++)
00476         {
00477                 tmp1 = P[k] * uscale + u * (Q[k] - P[k]);
00478                 tmp2 = R[k] * uscale + u * (S[k] - R[k]);
00479 
00480                 tmp1 = tmp1 * 4 + v * (tmp2 - tmp1);
00481 
00482                 Result[k] = tmp1;
00483         }
00484 
00485         // Lop off the appropriate number of bits to get us to 8 bit precision
00486         if(Do2bitMode)
00487         {
00488                 // do RGB
00489                 for(k = 0; k < 3; k++)
00490                 {
00491                         Result[k] >>= 2;
00492                 }
00493 
00494                 Result[3] >>= 1;
00495         }
00496         else
00497         {
00498                 // do RGB  (A is ok)
00499                 for(k = 0; k < 3; k++)
00500                 {
00501                         Result[k] >>= 1;
00502                 }
00503         }
00504 
00505         // sanity check
00506         for(k = 0; k < 4; k++)
00507         {
00508                 assert(Result[k] < 256);
00509         }
00510 
00511 
00512         /*
00513                 Convert from 5554 to 8888
00514 
00515                 do RGB 5.3 => 8
00516         */
00517         for(k = 0; k < 3; k++)
00518         {
00519                 Result[k] += Result[k] >> 5;
00520         }
00521 
00522         Result[3] += Result[3] >> 4;
00523 
00524         // 2nd sanity check
00525         for(k = 0; k < 4; k++)
00526         {
00527                 assert(Result[k] < 256);
00528         }
00529 
00530 }
00531 
00532 /*!***********************************************************************
00533  @Function              GetModulationValue
00534  @Input                 x
00535  @Input                 y
00536  @Input                 Do2bitMode
00537  @Input                 ModulationVals
00538  @Input                 ModulationModes
00539  @Input                 Mod
00540  @Input                 DoPT
00541  @Description   Get the modulation value as a numerator of a fraction of 8ths
00542 *************************************************************************/
00543 static void GetModulationValue(int x,
00544                                                            int y,
00545                                                            const int Do2bitMode,
00546                                                            const int ModulationVals[8][16],
00547                                                            const int ModulationModes[8][16],
00548                                                            int *Mod,
00549                                                            int *DoPT)
00550 {
00551         static const int RepVals0[4] = {0, 3, 5, 8};
00552         static const int RepVals1[4] = {0, 4, 4, 8};
00553 
00554         int ModVal;
00555 
00556         // Map X and Y into the local 2x2 block
00557         y = (y & 0x3) | ((~y & 0x2) << 1);
00558 
00559         if(Do2bitMode)
00560                 x = (x & 0x7) | ((~x & 0x4) << 1);
00561         else
00562                 x = (x & 0x3) | ((~x & 0x2) << 1);
00563 
00564         // assume no PT for now
00565         *DoPT = 0;
00566 
00567         // extract the modulation value. If a simple encoding
00568         if(ModulationModes[y][x]==0)
00569         {
00570                 ModVal = RepVals0[ModulationVals[y][x]];
00571         }
00572         else if(Do2bitMode)
00573         {
00574                 // if this is a stored value
00575                 if(((x^y)&1)==0)
00576                         ModVal = RepVals0[ModulationVals[y][x]];
00577                 else if(ModulationModes[y][x] == 1) // else average from the neighbours if H&V interpolation..
00578                 {
00579                         ModVal = (RepVals0[ModulationVals[y-1][x]] +
00580                                           RepVals0[ModulationVals[y+1][x]] +
00581                                           RepVals0[ModulationVals[y][x-1]] +
00582                                           RepVals0[ModulationVals[y][x+1]] + 2) / 4;
00583                 }
00584                 else if(ModulationModes[y][x] == 2) // else if H-Only
00585                 {
00586                         ModVal = (RepVals0[ModulationVals[y][x-1]] +
00587                                           RepVals0[ModulationVals[y][x+1]] + 1) / 2;
00588                 }
00589                 else // else it's V-Only
00590                 {
00591                         ModVal = (RepVals0[ModulationVals[y-1][x]] +
00592                                           RepVals0[ModulationVals[y+1][x]] + 1) / 2;
00593                 }
00594         }
00595         else // else it's 4BPP and PT encoding
00596         {
00597                 ModVal = RepVals1[ModulationVals[y][x]];
00598 
00599                 *DoPT = ModulationVals[y][x] == PT_INDEX;
00600         }
00601 
00602         *Mod =ModVal;
00603 }
00604 
00605 /*!***********************************************************************
00606  @Function              TwiddleUV
00607  @Input                 YSize   Y dimension of the texture in pixels
00608  @Input                 XSize   X dimension of the texture in pixels
00609  @Input                 YPos    Pixel Y position
00610  @Input                 XPos    Pixel X position
00611  @Returns               The twiddled offset of the pixel
00612  @Description   Given the Block (or pixel) coordinates and the dimension of
00613                                 the texture in blocks (or pixels) this returns the twiddled
00614                                 offset of the block (or pixel) from the start of the map.
00615 
00616                                 NOTE the dimensions of the texture must be a power of 2
00617 *************************************************************************/
00618 static int DisableTwiddlingRoutine = 0;
00619 
00620 static U32 TwiddleUV(U32 YSize, U32 XSize, U32 YPos, U32 XPos)
00621 {
00622         U32 Twiddled;
00623 
00624         U32 MinDimension;
00625         U32 MaxValue;
00626 
00627         U32 SrcBitPos;
00628         U32 DstBitPos;
00629 
00630         int ShiftCount;
00631 
00632         assert(YPos < YSize);
00633         assert(XPos < XSize);
00634 
00635         assert(POWER_OF_2(YSize));
00636         assert(POWER_OF_2(XSize));
00637 
00638         if(YSize < XSize)
00639         {
00640                 MinDimension = YSize;
00641                 MaxValue         = XPos;
00642         }
00643         else
00644         {
00645                 MinDimension = XSize;
00646                 MaxValue         = YPos;
00647         }
00648 
00649         // Nasty hack to disable twiddling
00650         if(DisableTwiddlingRoutine)
00651                 return (YPos* XSize + XPos);
00652 
00653         // Step through all the bits in the "minimum" dimension
00654         SrcBitPos = 1;
00655         DstBitPos = 1;
00656         Twiddled  = 0;
00657         ShiftCount = 0;
00658 
00659         while(SrcBitPos < MinDimension)
00660         {
00661                 if(YPos & SrcBitPos)
00662                 {
00663                         Twiddled |= DstBitPos;
00664                 }
00665 
00666                 if(XPos & SrcBitPos)
00667                 {
00668                         Twiddled |= (DstBitPos << 1);
00669                 }
00670 
00671 
00672                 SrcBitPos <<= 1;
00673                 DstBitPos <<= 2;
00674                 ShiftCount += 1;
00675 
00676         }
00677 
00678         // prepend any unused bits
00679         MaxValue >>= ShiftCount;
00680 
00681         Twiddled |=  (MaxValue << (2*ShiftCount));
00682 
00683         return Twiddled;
00684 }
00685 
00686 /***********************************************************/
00687 /*
00688 // Decompress
00689 //
00690 // Takes the compressed input data and outputs the equivalent decompressed
00691 // image.
00692 */
00693 /***********************************************************/
00694 
00695 static void Decompress(AMTC_BLOCK_STRUCT *pCompressedData,
00696                                            const int Do2bitMode,
00697                                            const int XDim,
00698                                            const int YDim,
00699                                            const int AssumeImageTiles,
00700                                            unsigned char* pResultImage)
00701 {
00702         int x, y;
00703         int i, j;
00704 
00705         int BlkX, BlkY;
00706         int BlkXp1, BlkYp1;
00707         int XBlockSize;
00708         int BlkXDim, BlkYDim;
00709 
00710         int StartX, StartY;
00711 
00712         int ModulationVals[8][16];
00713         int ModulationModes[8][16];
00714 
00715         int Mod, DoPT;
00716 
00717         unsigned int uPosition;
00718 
00719         /*
00720         // local neighbourhood of blocks
00721         */
00722         AMTC_BLOCK_STRUCT *pBlocks[2][2];
00723 
00724         AMTC_BLOCK_STRUCT *pPrevious[2][2] = {{NULL, NULL}, {NULL, NULL}};
00725 
00726         /*
00727         // Low precision colours extracted from the blocks
00728         */
00729         struct
00730         {
00731                 int Reps[2][4];
00732         }Colours5554[2][2];
00733 
00734         /*
00735         // Interpolated A and B colours for the pixel
00736         */
00737         int ASig[4], BSig[4];
00738 
00739         int Result[4];
00740 
00741         if(Do2bitMode)
00742         {
00743                 XBlockSize = BLK_X_2BPP;
00744         }
00745         else
00746         {
00747                 XBlockSize = BLK_X_4BPP;
00748         }
00749 
00750 
00751         /*
00752         // For MBX don't allow the sizes to get too small
00753         */
00754         BlkXDim = PVRT_MAX(2, XDim / XBlockSize);
00755         BlkYDim = PVRT_MAX(2, YDim / BLK_Y_SIZE);
00756 
00757         /*
00758         // Step through the pixels of the image decompressing each one in turn
00759         //
00760         // Note that this is a hideously inefficient way to do this!
00761         */
00762         for(y = 0; y < YDim; y++)
00763         {
00764                 for(x = 0; x < XDim; x++)
00765                 {
00766                         /*
00767                         // map this pixel to the top left neighbourhood of blocks
00768                         */
00769                         BlkX = (x - XBlockSize/2);
00770                         BlkY = (y - BLK_Y_SIZE/2);
00771 
00772                         BlkX = LIMIT_COORD(BlkX, XDim, AssumeImageTiles);
00773                         BlkY = LIMIT_COORD(BlkY, YDim, AssumeImageTiles);
00774 
00775 
00776                         BlkX /= XBlockSize;
00777                         BlkY /= BLK_Y_SIZE;
00778 
00779                         //BlkX = LIMIT_COORD(BlkX, BlkXDim, AssumeImageTiles);
00780                         //BlkY = LIMIT_COORD(BlkY, BlkYDim, AssumeImageTiles);
00781 
00782 
00783                         /*
00784                         // compute the positions of the other 3 blocks
00785                         */
00786                         BlkXp1 = LIMIT_COORD(BlkX+1, BlkXDim, AssumeImageTiles);
00787                         BlkYp1 = LIMIT_COORD(BlkY+1, BlkYDim, AssumeImageTiles);
00788 
00789                         /*
00790                         // Map to block memory locations
00791                         */
00792                         pBlocks[0][0] = pCompressedData +TwiddleUV(BlkYDim, BlkXDim, BlkY, BlkX);
00793                         pBlocks[0][1] = pCompressedData +TwiddleUV(BlkYDim, BlkXDim, BlkY, BlkXp1);
00794                         pBlocks[1][0] = pCompressedData +TwiddleUV(BlkYDim, BlkXDim, BlkYp1, BlkX);
00795                         pBlocks[1][1] = pCompressedData +TwiddleUV(BlkYDim, BlkXDim, BlkYp1, BlkXp1);
00796 
00797 
00798                         /*
00799                         // extract the colours and the modulation information IF the previous values
00800                         // have changed.
00801                         */
00802                         if(memcmp(pPrevious, pBlocks, 4*sizeof(void*)) != 0)
00803                         {
00804                                 StartY = 0;
00805                                 for(i = 0; i < 2; i++)
00806                                 {
00807                                         StartX = 0;
00808                                         for(j = 0; j < 2; j++)
00809                                         {
00810                                                 Unpack5554Colour(pBlocks[i][j], Colours5554[i][j].Reps);
00811 
00812                                                 UnpackModulations(pBlocks[i][j],
00813                                                         Do2bitMode,
00814                                                         ModulationVals,
00815                                                         ModulationModes,
00816                                                         StartX, StartY);
00817 
00818                                                 StartX += XBlockSize;
00819                                         }/*end for j*/
00820 
00821                                         StartY += BLK_Y_SIZE;
00822                                 }/*end for i*/
00823 
00824                                 /*
00825                                 // make a copy of the new pointers
00826                                 */
00827                                 memcpy(pPrevious, pBlocks, 4*sizeof(void*));
00828                         }/*end if the blocks have changed*/
00829 
00830 
00831                         /*
00832                         // decompress the pixel.  First compute the interpolated A and B signals
00833                         */
00834                         InterpolateColours(Colours5554[0][0].Reps[0],
00835                                 Colours5554[0][1].Reps[0],
00836                                 Colours5554[1][0].Reps[0],
00837                                 Colours5554[1][1].Reps[0],
00838                                 Do2bitMode, x, y,
00839                                 ASig);
00840 
00841                         InterpolateColours(Colours5554[0][0].Reps[1],
00842                                 Colours5554[0][1].Reps[1],
00843                                 Colours5554[1][0].Reps[1],
00844                                 Colours5554[1][1].Reps[1],
00845                                 Do2bitMode, x, y,
00846                                 BSig);
00847 
00848                         GetModulationValue(x,y, Do2bitMode, (const int (*)[16])ModulationVals, (const int (*)[16])ModulationModes,
00849                                 &Mod, &DoPT);
00850 
00851                         /*
00852                         // compute the modulated colour
00853                         */
00854                         for(i = 0; i < 4; i++)
00855                         {
00856                                 Result[i] = ASig[i] * 8 + Mod * (BSig[i] - ASig[i]);
00857                                 Result[i] >>= 3;
00858                         }
00859                         if(DoPT)
00860                         {
00861                                 Result[3] = 0;
00862                         }
00863 
00864                         /*
00865                         // Store the result in the output image
00866                         */
00867                         uPosition = (x+y*XDim)<<2;
00868                         pResultImage[uPosition+0] = (unsigned char)Result[0];
00869                         pResultImage[uPosition+1] = (unsigned char)Result[1];
00870                         pResultImage[uPosition+2] = (unsigned char)Result[2];
00871                         pResultImage[uPosition+3] = (unsigned char)Result[3];
00872 
00873                 }/*end for x*/
00874         }/*end for y*/
00875 
00876 }
00877 
00878 static void * stbi__pvr_load(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00879 {
00880         stbi_uc *pvr_data = NULL;
00881         stbi_uc *pvr_res_data = NULL;
00882         PVR_Texture_Header header={0};
00883         int iscompressed = 0;
00884         int bitmode = 0;
00885         unsigned int levelSize = 0;
00886 
00887         stbi__getn( s, (stbi_uc*)(&header), sizeof(PVR_Texture_Header) );
00888 
00889         // Check the header size
00890         if ( header.dwHeaderSize != sizeof(PVR_Texture_Header) ) {
00891                 return NULL;
00892         }
00893 
00894         // Check the magic identifier
00895         if ( header.dwPVR != PVRTEX_IDENTIFIER ) {
00896                 return NULL;
00897         }
00898 
00899         *x = s->img_x = header.dwWidth;
00900         *y = s->img_y = header.dwHeight;
00901 
00902         /* Get if the texture is compressed and the texture mode ( 2bpp or 4bpp ) */
00903         switch ( header.dwpfFlags & PVRTEX_PIXELTYPE )
00904         {
00905                 case OGL_RGBA_4444:
00906                         s->img_n = 2;
00907                         break;
00908                 case OGL_RGBA_5551:
00909                         s->img_n = 2;
00910                         break;
00911                 case OGL_RGBA_8888:
00912                         s->img_n = 4;
00913                         break;
00914                 case OGL_RGB_565:
00915                         s->img_n = 2;
00916                         break;
00917                 case OGL_RGB_888:
00918                         s->img_n = 3;
00919                         break;
00920                 case OGL_I_8:
00921                         s->img_n = 1;
00922                         break;
00923                 case OGL_AI_88:
00924                         s->img_n = 2;
00925                         break;
00926                 case OGL_PVRTC2:
00927                         bitmode = 1;
00928                         s->img_n = 4;
00929                         iscompressed = 1;
00930                         break;
00931                 case OGL_PVRTC4:
00932                         s->img_n = 4;
00933                         iscompressed = 1;
00934                         break;
00935                 case OGL_RGB_555:
00936                 default:
00937                         return NULL;
00938         }
00939 
00940         *comp = s->img_n;
00941 
00942         // Load only the first mip map level
00943         levelSize = (s->img_x * s->img_y * header.dwBitCount + 7) / 8;
00944 
00945         // get the raw data
00946         pvr_data = (stbi_uc *)malloc( levelSize );
00947         stbi__getn( s, pvr_data, levelSize );
00948 
00949         // if compressed decompress as RGBA
00950         if ( iscompressed ) {
00951                 pvr_res_data = (stbi_uc *)malloc( s->img_x * s->img_y * 4 );
00952                 Decompress( (AMTC_BLOCK_STRUCT*)pvr_data, bitmode, s->img_x, s->img_y, 1, (unsigned char*)pvr_res_data );
00953                 free( pvr_data );
00954         } else {
00955                 // otherwise use the raw data
00956                 pvr_res_data = pvr_data;
00957         }
00958 
00959         if( (req_comp <= 4) && (req_comp >= 1) ) {
00960                 //      user has some requirements, meet them
00961                 if( req_comp != s->img_n ) {
00962                         pvr_res_data = stbi__convert_format( pvr_res_data, s->img_n, req_comp, s->img_x, s->img_y );
00963                         *comp = req_comp;
00964                 }
00965         }
00966 
00967         return pvr_res_data;
00968 }
00969 
00970 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00971 void *stbi__pvr_load_from_file   (FILE *f,                  int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00972 {
00973         stbi__context s;
00974         stbi__start_file(&s,f);
00975         return stbi__pvr_load(&s,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00976 }
00977 
00978 void *stbi__pvr_load_from_path             (char const*filename,           int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00979 {
00980    void *data;
00981    FILE *f = fopen(filename, "rb");
00982    if (!f) return NULL;
00983    data = stbi__pvr_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00984    fclose(f);
00985    return data;
00986 }
00987 #endif
00988 
00989 void *stbi__pvr_load_from_memory (stbi_uc const *buffer, int len, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00990 {
00991    stbi__context s;
00992    stbi__start_mem(&s,buffer, len);
00993    return stbi__pvr_load(&s,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00994 }
00995 
00996 void *stbi__pvr_load_from_callbacks (stbi_io_callbacks const *clbk, void *user, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00997 {
00998         stbi__context s;
00999    stbi__start_callbacks(&s, (stbi_io_callbacks *) clbk, user);
01000    return stbi__pvr_load(&s,x,y,comp,req_comp);
01001 }
